intro: Acropelta caruifolia, commonly known as the featherleaf acropelta, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, feather-like leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Acropelta caruifolia is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
